intro: Daucus martellii, commonly known as the Chinese carrot or wild carrot, is a flowering plant native to China and parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes other familiar plants like parsley and dill. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, white to yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a dry, two-lobed structure called a schizocarp, typical of the Apiaceae family. Daucus martellii is often found in grassy areas and along roadsides, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
